hanzi-su-wiki:
跡

Значения

След, отпечаток

Мнемоника

То же 亦, что и нога 足, т.е. её отпечаток, след.

Варианты

迹, 蹟
purpleculture_pinyin:
jì
footprint; mark; trace; vestige; sign; indication; Taiwan pr. [ji1]
след; отметка; след; пережиток; знак; индикация; Тайвань пр. [ji1]
rtega_mnemonic:
跡跡RS
迹迹		search, track, trace, impression
  • tracks of a wet person's 亦 foot 足
  • ⓢ tracks of a walking 辶 wet person 亦
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 迹)
Pictophonetic: 亦 indicates the sound; 足 (foot) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 跡象 [ jì xiàng ]: mark; indication; sign; indicator
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 足 [ zú ] foot; to attain, to satisfy; enough
    • 亦 [ yì ] also, too; likewise
heisig_chinese_memo: Pirate pokes the tip of his wooden leg into an apple to disguise his tracks and give indications that he didn't go the way he did.
heisig_constituent: tracks, wooden leg, mouth, stop, footprint, apple
koohiiStory1: Pirate pokes the tip of his wooden leg into an apple to disguise his tracks.
koohiiStory2: To hide his distinctive wood-leg tracks, this pirate is throwing apples after his tracks in order for animals to come and confuse his tracks.
jp_example_words:
跡継ぎ(あとつぎ): heir, successor
遺跡(いせき): historic ruins (remains relics)
追跡(ついせき): pursuit
跡切れる(とぎれる): to pause, to be interrupted
足跡(あしあと): footprints
跡(あと): trace, tracks, mark, sign, remains, ruins, scar
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Your foot is a little red and you can see traces of ink streaked on it. Where did these traces come from?
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You look closer at your foot, examining the traces of red ink, and slowly the night before comes back to you.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Turns out the traces of red ink were from a sexy (せき) rave you were at last night. Everyone around you looked so sexy, with their glow-in-the-dark paint, so you decided to put some of the red ink on your feet so everyone could see your sexy dancing.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: As you feel the sexy, confident feelings return, you see traces of the ink on your carpet, all the way from the door to the bed. Dang it.
Ru_Radicals: 亠 (крышка), 口 (рот), 止 (останавливать), 赤 (красный), 足 (нога)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: again (亦) the foot (⻊) leaves a trace
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: An apple core on the road might be an indication of a tasty apple tree nearby. Or maybe just an ignorant person driving ahead of you and throwing things out the window.
humanum_short_description_en: " Trace " is the same as " Trace ". " Foot " and "辵" are righteous symbols. See " trace ".
humanum_short_description: 「跡」同「迹」。「足」和「辵」是義近形符。參見「迹」。

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 亦 indicates the sound; 足 (foot) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 足 [ zú ] foot; to attain, to satisfy; enough
    • 亦 [ yì ] also, too; likewise
①腳印：蹤跡。足跡。血跡。筆跡。
②物體遺留下的印痕：印跡。
③前人遺留下的事物：古蹟。實跡。
④追尋蹤跡：“漢求將軍急，跡且至臣家”。
⑤據實跡考知：“跡漢功臣，亦皆割符世爵”。

Liushutong characters (6)

跡字的基本解释

跡
jì
同“迹”。

跡字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jī］
［《廣韻》資昔切，入昔，精。］
亦作“跡1”。亦作“蹟1”。
(1)脚印；足迹。
(2)痕迹。
(3)指手迹。
(4)形迹；行动。
(5)业绩；事迹。
(6)追踪；追寻。
(7)至；蹈。
(8)遵循；仿效。
(9)考核；推究。
(10)量词。相当于“步”。

跡字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【足字部】　跡； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1224第16
【廣韻】【集韻】【正韻】?資昔切，音積。與迹同。【釋名】跡，積也。積累而前也。【類篇】跡，步處也。　又【韻補】叶卽略切【陸機·演連珠】火壯則烟微，性充則情約。是以殷墟有感物之悲，周京無竚立之跡。

跡字的源字形

trace
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jī］
["Guangyun" Zixi cuts, enters the past, refined. ]
Also referred to as "trace 1". Also referred to as "trace 1".
(1) Footprints; footprints.
(2) Traces.
(3) Refers to handwriting.
(4) Form; action.
(5) Performance; deeds.
(6) Tracking; Pursuing.
(7) To; dance.
(8) Follow; imitate.
(9) Assessment; Examination.
(10) Quantifiers. Equivalent to "step".
trace
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Unitary Collection] [Foot Character Department] 　緒; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 1224-16
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun]? Zi Xiqie, phonetic product. Same as trace. 【Release name】Trace, accumulate. Accumulate and move forward. [Classes] Traces, every step.　 [Rhyme Supplement] Ye Yu slightly cuts [Lu Ji·Yan Lianzhu] If the fire is strong, the smoke is weak, and the sex is full of love. Because of the sadness of the Yin Ruins, Zhou Jing has no trace of standing.

jì

Radicals: 足, 赤  (foot, red)
Meaning Mnemonic
Your foot is a little red and you can see traces of ink streaked on it. Where did these traces come from?
You look closer at your foot, examining the traces of red ink, and slowly the night before comes back to you.
Reading Mnemonic
Turns out the traces of red ink were from a sexy (せき) rave you were at last night. Everyone around you looked so sexy, with their glow-in-the-dark paint, so you decided to put some of the red ink on your feet so everyone could see your sexy dancing.
As you feel the sexy, confident feelings return, you see traces of the ink on your carpet, all the way from the door to the bed. Dang it.
